com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job

Interface Job

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed, RunnableEntity
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Workload
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JobDefault, WorkloadDefault

    public interface Job
extends Entity, RunnableEntity
    A Job is a RunnableEntity that runs on top of a VirtualMachine.

    A job may own a variable amount of children Operations. It may also have a variable of RemoteOperations where it is defined as their destination job.
    You can use getOperations() and getRemoteOperations() to list them.

    Accordingly to the RunnableEntity contract children Operation must be paused / started / terminated if their parent job's state is updated.
    Following the same logic and regarding RemoteOperations (which have defined a given job as their destination job), implementations of this interface must also apply these next rules:

    • when the job is paused, then the RemoteOperations are paused;
    • when the job is started, then the RemoteOperations are started (if they can be);
    • when the job is restarted, then the RemoteOperations are canceled;
    • when the job is canceled, then the RemoteOperations are canceled;
    • when the job fails, then the RemoteOperations fail;
    • when the job is terminated, then the RemoteOperations are terminated;
    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        Job clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier
        Specified by:
        clone in interface RunnableEntity

      • setPriority

        void setPriority(int priority)
        Updates the job's priority.

        The job needs to be in a non running state.

        A NotificationCodes.JOB_PRIORITY_CHANGED notification is thrown.

        Parameters:
        priority -
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the job is running

      • compute

        ComputingOperation compute(long lengthInMi,
                         NotificationListener listener)
        Creates and starts a new ComputingOperation with the given length in MI. The created operation is returned, but null can also be returned if the operation cannot be created/started.
        Parameters:
        lengthInMi -
        listener - a listener that is added for the CoreNotificationCodes.RUNNABLE_STATE_CHANGED notification code, before the operation is started. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the created ComputingOperation, or null

      • allocateRam

        RamZone allocateRam(long size)
        Creates and returns a new RamZone after putting it inside the VirtualRam of the parent's VM. null can be returned if the parent VM has no virtual ram or not enough space.
        Parameters:
        size -
        Returns:
        the created RamZone, or null

      • readFile

        StorageOperation readFile(StorageFile file,
                        long filePos,
                        long size,
                        NotificationListener listener)
        Creates and starts a read operation on the given file. The created operation is returned, but null can also be returned if the operation cannot be created/started.
        Parameters:
        file -
        filePos - 0 or the position where to start to read from.
        size - maximum size to read (if not EOF)
        listener - a listener that is added for the CoreNotificationCodes.RUNNABLE_STATE_CHANGED notification code, before the operation is started. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the created operation, or null
        See Also:
        StorageOperation

      • sendData

        NetworkOperation sendData(Job destinationJob,
                        long dataSize,
                        NotificationListener listener)
        Creates and starts a network operation to send the given dataSize to the given destinationJob. The created operation is returned, but null can also be returned if the operation cannot be created/started.
        Parameters:

        dataSize -

        Returns:
        the created operation, or null
        See Also:
        NetworkOperation

      • sendData

        NetworkOperation sendData(Host destinationHost,
                        long dataSize,
                        NotificationListener listener)
        Creates and starts a network operation to send the given dataSize to the given destinationHost. The created operation is returned, but null can also be returned if the operation cannot be created/started.

        This method will automatically create a job and a virtual machine on destination host to receive the data.
        Created virtual machine is owned by the same user as the parent virtual machine of current job.
        When the operation ends, the created virtual machine is discarded.

        See Also:
        sendData(Job, long, NotificationListener)

      • scheduleSignal

        TimerOperation scheduleSignal(long delay,
                            NotificationListener listener)
        Creates and starts a TimerOperation with the given delay. The created operation is returned, but null can also be returned if the operation cannot be created/started.
        Parameters:
        delay -
        listener - a listener that is added for the CoreNotificationCodes.RUNNABLE_STATE_CHANGED notification code, before the operation is started. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the created TimerOperation, or null
